data.title: D2k Tech Level
data.body:
I added Tech Levels to D2K.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7933210/3522313/38ffd0c8-074b-11e4-9ffe-dfc075e4e78b.png)
(Low Tech Level)

data.title: Restore blinking ready label in RA.
data.body: This change has been controversial, and our "hardcore" ra players are a conservative bunch who don't like change.  This restores the old blinking behaviour in RA, but keeps the alternating colour in D2K.

data.title: Fixed missing parachute corpses in Dune 2000
data.body: as described in #5893.

data.title: Added Volkov From  Expansions
data.body: I added volkov from expansions of RA. I think there is a balance problem. About infantries. Tanya is very powerful anti infantry. but soviets don't have anyother thing like it. They have Sniper but they have very high ROF. Volkov is not the same of Tanya. His ROF is better(because he is using MP5) but range and damage is slightly low. At RA he don't have any icon because he is not buildable. I used Volkov icon from RA2 DeeZire mod.

data.title: Fix NRE if a unit is damaged without a warhead.
Unit `explosion` does not have a sequence named `corpse`
data.body:
#5695 introduced a crash for D2K.


data.title: Added a check if the rearm host building is gone
data.body: Brings it in line with https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.RA/Activities/Repair.cs#L27. Could fix #5670.

data.title: Added captureable tech for Dune 2000
data.body: Completes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2187 for all shipped mods.

data.title: Made GetSpawnOccupants more robust against invalid list queries
data.body: Hopefully finally fixes #5588.

data.title: Allow attack voice type to be configured per-actor.
data.body:
I made a unique voice profile called "HealerVoice", so that Medic and Mechanic voices do not output Attack: voices when commanding them to heal. However, it is not working, and they still call the original Attack: voices.

```
HealerVoice:
        Variants:
                squirrels: .squirrels.wav
                tediz: .tediz.wav
                weasels: .weasels.wav
        Voices:
                Select: select1,select2,select3
                Move: move1,move2,move3,move4
                Attack: move1,move2,move3,move4
                Die: death1,death2,death3,death4,death5,death6,death7
                Burned: death1,death2,death3,death4,death5,death6,death7
                Zapped: death1,death2,death3,death4,death5,death6,death7

MEDI:
        Inherits: ^Infantry
        Buildable:
                Queue: Infantry
                BuildPaletteOrder: 41
                Owner: squirrels,tediz,weasels
                Hotkey: m
        Valued:
                Cost: 200
        Tooltip:
                Name: Medic
                Description: Heals nearby infantry.\n  Strong vs Nothing\n  Weak vs Everything
        Selectable:
                Voice: HealerVoice
                Bounds: 12,17,0,-9
        Health:
                HP: 80
        Mobile:
                Speed: 56
        RevealsShroud:
                Range: 3c0
        Passenger:
                PipType: Yellow
        AutoHeal:
        Armament:
                Weapon: Heal
        AttackMedic:
                Cursor: heal
                OutsideRangeCursor: heal
        TakeCover:
        -AutoTarget:
        -RenderInfantry:
        RenderInfantryProne:
                IdleAnimations: idle1,idle2

MECH:
        Inherits: ^Infantry
        Buildable:
                Queue: Infantry
                BuildPaletteOrder: 42
                Owner: squirrels,tediz,weasels
                Prerequisites: fix
                Hotkey: c
        Valued:
                Cost: 500
        Tooltip:
                Name: Mechanic
                Description: Repairs nearby vehicles and restores\nhusks to working condition.\n  Strong vs Nothing\n  Weak vs Everything
        Selectable:
                Voice: HealerVoice
                Bounds: 12,17,0,-9
        Health:
                HP: 80
        Mobile:
                Speed: 56
        RevealsShroud:
                Range: 3c0
        Passenger:
                PipType: Yellow
        AutoHeal:
        Armament:
                Weapon: Repair
        AttackMedic:
                Cursor: repair
                OutsideRangeCursor: repair
        Captures:
                CaptureTypes: husk
        TakeCover:
        -AutoTarget:
        -RenderInfantry:
        RenderInfantryProne:
                IdleAnimations: idle1,idle2
```
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3030594-allow-attack-voice-type-to-be-configured-per-actor?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Fixed captureable tech oversights in the Red Alert mod
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5759 that fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5881.

data.title: Strange Render(Infantry) attack anim errors
data.body:
- [ ] 1) Sometimes the last frame will be omitted. As a result, the last frame with a muzzle flash is shown instead of the last frame of the animation (so if the attack anim is 6 frames long, frame 5 is shown at the end).
- [x] 2) Even after being ordered to stop, infantry tends to not go back into idle state, at least it doesn't go back to idle animations.

This screenshot shows both problems (the rifle infantry has been ordered to stop and actually stopped shooting quite a while ago):

![render-error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2857877/3512958/964e7924-06be-11e4-93b7-a8a896b9bb67.png)

For the record, it has been like that for ages, I just kept forgetting to report it.

data.title: Added Tiberium healing for mutants, cyborgs and creatures
data.body:
Fixes #5877.
Additionally fixed the projectile palette and added inaccuracy for the Tiberian Fiend's weapon. Increased the Fiend's health radius a little as well.

data.title: Friendly fire modifier
data.body:
Implementation for #5618.

ValidTarget and InvalidTarget on weapon allows/prevents targeting. (<- Was an existing feature)
ValidTarget and InvalidTarget on warhead allows/prevents damage + spread damage. (New)
ValidTarget and InvalidTarget on both weapon and warheads now understand the following keywords related to stances/diplomacy: "Ally", "Neutral", "Enemy" (New)

Tanya is buildable by Soviets. It is odd but i think it is for balance. If it is for balance we can add Volkov from expansions to Soviets.

data.title: Desura: Playtest version on Windows doesn't launch (missing SDL.dll)
data.body:
After installing Desura (#5878), I tried to test the Playtest version but nothing happened. OpenRA didn't crash, didn't freeze, it just didn't launched.

```
Exception of type `System.DllNotFoundException`: Impossible de charger la DLL 'SDL.dll': Le module spcifi est introuvable. (Exception de HRESULT : 0x8007007E)
TypeName=``
    Tao.Sdl.Sdl.__SDL_Init(Int32 flags)
    Tao.Sdl.Sdl.SDL_Init(Int32 flags)
    OpenRA.Renderer.SdlCommon.SdlGraphics.InitializeSdlGl(Size& size, WindowMode window, String[] requiredExtensions)
    OpenRA.Renderer.SdlCommon.SdlGraphics..ctor(Size size, WindowMode window, String[] extensions)
    OpenRA.Renderer.Glsl.DeviceFactory.Create(Size size, WindowMode windowMode)
    OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.CreateDevice(Assembly rendererDll, Int32 width, Int32 height, WindowMode window)
    OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.Initialize(WindowMode windowMode)
    OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
    OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
    OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

It seems SDL.dll is missing in the Playtest version.

data.title: Desura: Impossibility to have both Release and Playtest side-by-side
data.body:
I have successfully installed Desura on Windows 8.1 (and I have to say that it was simple as pie). I have always wanted a way to get automatic updates and now I have it. I really don't know why I hesitated to install Desura.. maybe because signing up is required, maybe because Desura is less known than Steam.. Dunno. Anyway, now I have Desura, yay! ![rolleyes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/3507183/660e68de-067b-11e4-900b-e3d597f4c95b.png)

The only con I noticed is the impossibility to install both Release and Playtest side-by-side. 

To test, I tried to install the Playtest (after installing successfully installing Release) but instead of installing another instance of OpenRA, it replaced the Release version. :(

![screenshot002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/3507054/c6399a50-0679-11e4-8e26-06bc450efcd3.png)

Is there a way to have both?

data.title: Missing map editor tiles for D2k missions
data.body:
So, I started manually reproducing maps for D2k in ORA format, and noticed that even in the first map there's some major things missing. I concreted the tiles I couldn't find for reference...

![a1v1 missing tiles](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3319884/3503328/9018d40e-062e-11e4-8829-0cba3a00ca7c.png)

1 - There should be a 3 wide 1 tall crater here, it's pretty distinctive and definitely not in the available tiles.

2 - We don't seem to be able to place dense spice in the editor.

3 - This may need to be scripted by lua eventually, however a worm should spawn here.

4 - We're missing the corner graphic for the smooth rock-sand transition here, where the southwest corner is rock and all the other corners are sand. This is also the bottom-most concrete tile, but I forgot to highlight that one, too.

5 - Essentially the same issue as 4, but this time it's the corner where the northwest is rock and all other corners are sand. I've checked and the two other corners of this type are usable, and all four corners with three corners rock and one corner sand show up fine as well, so it's just these two one-tile corners that are missing.

Unlabelled - For the other two unlabelled concrete tiles, there's a 1-square rock graphic with an odd smudge that goes here, but I suspect it's somewhere in a larger formation in the map editor and I haven't found it to cut it up.

Everything but (3) should definitely be fixed for multiplayer maps anyway, so even if an import is worked out for D2k missions, the other "missing tiles" will still need resolving.

For comparison, here's what it should look like completed, including units and structures:

![a1v1 complete](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3319884/3503397/22d6a086-0630-11e4-92bf-4291c6d99e6d.png)

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3008891-missing-map-editor-tiles-for-d2k-missions?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Revert TickRender and PauseState changes
data.body:
This backs out the desync-introducing changes so that we can ship a stable release.  Fixes #5870.

I will come up with an alternative approach for animations in the editor, because i'm sure @Mailaender is sick of me asking him to rewrite the same feature over and over again only to find a fatal flaw that makes each approach not work.

data.title: wish: change minimap and ingame gps markers to friendly / enemy with click
data.body:
I am really getting anoyed by ppl using the same color as the ground. Then I cannot see their units in the minimap, or can see the gps markers ingame..

Just a simple button / click on minimap to change it to green / red (friendly / enemy) would help that..

That is not the best solution, but this is getting really annoying and do change the balance in the game....

I think its cheating....

data.title: wish: Watch replay together after end of match
data.body:
"zypres has lost the game"
-"do you want to watch the replay together"?
-Host or first to click will controll the speed, or all users.
-Also option to press "watch it in 4x speed"

You can still chat while watching....and press location markers, and in the future draw on it.. Fun for the whole family....
